title: Is the new patch bugged? (6.15)
body:
{{summoner:3}} I keep getting this round of bugs and messages when i try to get into a game? 

-trying to reconnect
-> bugsplat
-> close the game 
->launcher says: "Sorry! we've detected some possible data corruption in your installation. Would you like to repair the affected file?"
(presses "OK")
-> downloading the patch over again
->login - reconnect - bugsplat...

have done this routine 4 times... have it happened to others? ( i have left some teammates in the rift now :( )

replies.body:
If a repair is not enough to clean up data corruption, I suggest reinstalling the client. You may use the [Hextech Repair Tool](https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/player-support/tools/Hextech%20Repair%20Tool.msi) with the **Reinstall** and **Clean Uninstall** boxes checked.

(HRT found on the [Network, System and Logs](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) support article)

Uninstalled game, cleaned computer from league, tried to reinstall. Got kernel crash before getting into patcher. Started hextech tool, forced to patch. Hextech crashed aswell. Anymore stones to throw at game?

I am currently doing a fresh download just as you and ran into the kernel crash. I ran it as admin and it fixed that problem. If you don't know how to do this the simple way is to right click LoL and select **run as administrator**. It will then ask you if it's okay, just hit yes and the download should work from there. I still don't know if a fresh download will work as I'm still patching. Will post back when done.

**!!!!!UPDATE!!!!!!!**
After a fresh install it worked for me. I did not have the new launcher until now so I'm curious how many people here also had the old launcher. 

To round up what I did:

1. I uninstalled LoL from my control Panel.

2. Downloaded the client from Riot's website -  https://signup.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/redownload

3. Patched the client under administrator. An easy way to do this is to right click the icon made when downloading the game and selecting "RUN AS ADMINISTRATOR".

4. Have fun.

Sadly I couldn't find a way around doing a fresh download, but it does work. I closed out and ran several games both as administrator and not and everything is working now.

Hope this helps!
Same issue, and I also got the old launcher. I'll try reinstalling LoL. Thanks for your comment! ^^

I updated my graphic card driver and everything is fine now. No need to reinstall league completely (at least for me).
Hope this works for you as well.

When you see constant bugsplats and the client requiring you to repair due to corruptions, then it's very likely that your League install is beyond repair. When crucial files are missing or corrupted, and the client is unable to repair them, the best course of action is to complete a clean reinstall, which *Deep Terror Nami* has provided instructions for. 

If you still see issues after taking those steps, please let me know.

Game crashes can typically be solved by performing a repair.

Repair the game by clicking the question mark icon to the top right of the patcher. Select "Repair" and let the patcher scan and repair corrupt game files. When the process is completed, you'll see the orange "Launch" button.

If you still experience crashes after this, refer to [Deep Terror Nami's post.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/UQlswuef-is-the-new-patch-bugged-615?comment=0000)

Riot has been tracking an issue with this patch where players who have the patcher pinned (instead of the desktop shortcut) to their Windows Task Bar consistently crash/Bug Splat when they attempt to get into a game after Champ Select. They are working on a hotfix ASAP, but there is a temporary work around to get this solved:


1. Un-pin League of Legends from your task bar.

2. Repair the game by clicking the question mark icon to the top right of the patcher. Select "Repair" and let the patcher scan and repair corrupt game files. When the process is completed, you'll see the orange "Launch" button.

3. Let us know the results.
